title: FIFO worker arrested over extremist material and anti-Semitic posts | 7NEWS
description: A 39-year-old former FIFO worker from Yanjabup, Western Australia, has been arrested after allegedly posting messages supporting the Bondi terrorist attack and making anti-Semitic statements online. Police raided his home and discovered six lawfully owned firearms, 4,000 rounds of ammunition, extremist material including Hezbollah and Hamas flags, notebooks with references to Hitler and the Holocaust, and what authorities describe as a bomb-making shopping list. Martin Thomas Glynn faces charges including conduct intended to racially harass, possessing a prohibited weapon, and failure to store a firearm. title: Girl fights for life after Trigg Beach drowning | 7NEWS
description: A 12-year-old girl remains in critical condition at Perth Children's Hospital after being caught in a rip at Trigg Beach's Blue Hole and found unresponsive. A local surfer rescued her companion while surf lifesavers and off-duty doctors performed CPR for 20 minutes before paramedics arrived. Authorities are urging beach safety ahead of Christmas with temperatures expected to reach 40 degrees, noting that 27 people drowned last year with over 990 rescues performed. title: Robbie Williams calls 94-year-old superfan, Norma
description: Robbie Williams has surprised an elderly fan in England with a special Christmas message. The superstar singer-songwriter spoke to Norma in a video call after a previous clip online showed the 94-year-old talking about how she wanted to see him. #robbiewilliams #facetime #grimsby #england #uk

title: The toys Aussie kids wanted for Christmas in 1985
description: From Barbie dolls and Cabbage Patch Kids to Transformers and board games, see what toys Aussie kids wanted for Christmas 40 years ago. #christmas #santa #toys #presents #gifts

title: Croatian divers put their own underwater twist on the festive celebrations
description: Everyone celebrates Christmas in a special way and these Croatian divers from the Underwater Sports Society, put their own underwater twist on the festive celebrations at the bottom of Lake Jarun. #Christmas #Croatia #Diver #Christmastree

title: Spencer, WI police arrest the Grinch for 'trying to steal Christmas'
description: Police in Spencer, Wisconsin arrested The Grinch after he was caught "trying to steal Christmas". The grumpy green menace was forced to sing Rudolph The Red-Nosed Reindeer as part of his punishment. #grinch #xmas #christmas #police #arrest

title: How to claim hundreds of dollars in Medicare benefits by logging onto myGov website
description: Did you know you could have hundreds of dollars in unclaimed Medicare benefits? If you're strapped for cash these holidays, the process to get the money is as easy as going onto the myGov website. 250,000 Australians aged between 18 to 24 are collectively owed $62.8 million, or $275 per person on average. #medicare #money #finance #mygov #servicesaustralia

title: 7NEWS archive: 2004 Boxing Day tsunami in Asia
description: It's been 21 years since the devastating Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami of 2004. It was Boxing Day when a 9.2-9.3 magnitude earthquake struck off the west coast of Aceh in northern Sumatra, Indonesia. Approximately 275,000 people were killed across 14 countries, marking it one of the largest natural disasters in recorded history. #tsunami #boxingdaytsunami #earthquake #naturaldisaster #Asia
